RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: S S SPARTAN ENERGY rounded the first turn about the four path, started a bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole and moved to the outside rounding the far turn, dug in for the lead the final yards and raced clear under the wire. HAZEDNCONFUSED bobbled at the break then settled in the three path the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, came between horses and dueled to a slim lead midway on the far turn, was steadily handled in the lane, though, flattened in the final yards. IN JUBALATION raced two deep on the opening turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced close in the five path of the far turn then flattened the final sixteenth. SIENTE EL AMOR stalked off the rail, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced close in the four path of the far turn, lugged to the rail in the upper stretch and flattened the final sixteenth. JEFFERSON SECURITY saved ground off the pace, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, eased outward leaving the turn but showed little further. BEAR'S ESTATE rated the pace inside, came under pressure past the seven sixteenths pole and was met at the rail midway on the far turn, then weakened in the lane. BOBBYS CASE LOAD showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Bear's Estate
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Rayan and Knoblauch Michelle R

ENTRY.NAME: Jefferson Security
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,rail far turn,eased out 1/8,little lane

ENTRY.NAME: Hazednconfused
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled break,3p 1st turn,bid 3/8,up between mid turn,caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 24000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Olde r, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 19 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 19 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REVEIRS MINUTE rated the pace inside, was urged away at the rail on the far turn then further extended her lead under steady stretch handling. MISS WAVE rounded the first turn about the five path, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and settled for second best. DENALI D'ORO stalked off the rail on the first turn then settled back, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased to the four path into the lane and came along to take third under the wire. SECRET CASTLE raced in the four path the opening turn and rated close leaving the turn, challenged toward the three eighths pole, but faded off the rail on the far turn. JAMESTOWN ROAD rated close in the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. CASTLE OF CAYLEE rounded the first turn in the four path and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Reveirs Minute
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,urged away rail far turn,widened driving

ENTRY.NAME: Denali d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,rail far turn,4p 1/8,along 3rd wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 55. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,00 0 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: APPEALING ROAD stalked from the four path the first turn, took over leaving the seven sixteenths pole and moved clear at the five sixteenths, widened near the rail through the far turn and was kept alert in the stretch. DEREKA'S BLUFF raced in the five path the first turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn three wide and dug in to clear second later yards. PRINCESS HALO rated off the pace inside, bid nearing the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and relented in the stretch duel for second. PETTYFORURTHOUGHTS raced with the early pace inside, was met leaving the seven sixteenths pole and gave chase from that point, rounded the far turn two deep then flattened stride. GOLDEN SALLY stalked two deep on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. AMELIA'S DREAM rated just off the pace and off the rail the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the four path on the far turn. HOOK THE CHAIN moved to the inside midway on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 24000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race Since July 19 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 19 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HERO'S MAN took over and moved to the inside past the three quarter pole and rated the pace, came under pressure past the three eighths, rounded the far turn near the rail and was kept alert in the stretch. BUFF'S EYE VIEW stalked off the rail, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then dueled through the stretch for second. GOLDEN APPEAL rated close in the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced two deep on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. SARGENT KOBE checked at the rail past the three quarter pole then saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but showed little response. The Stewards reviewed, then rejected, a claim of foul against the rider of Hero's Man for alleged interference past the three quarter pole, lodged by the rider of Sargent Kobe.

ENTRY.NAME: Hero's Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,kept alert lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIVINAS CONNECTION ducked in and made sharp contact with Shakin It Big time then settled off the rail on the first turn, edged closer leaving the half mile pole, rallied to the front approaching the quarter pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and was vigorously hand ridden in the lane. NORLANDER was hustled to the front then rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, gave up the lead at the rail toward the quarter pole and had to settle for second best. SHAKIN IT BIG TIME was squeezed at the break then saved ground well back from early contention, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, improved from that point and rounded the far turn about the four path, dug in leaving the turn and just lasted for third. FLOOR IT saved ground off the pace, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, passed rivals in the lane and just missed third. WAVE ACTION veered out and made contact with Shakin It Big Time leaving the gate then rounded the first turn in the four path, eased out into the backstretch, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the five path of the far turn then flattened stride. ROBBEDINTHEBAHAMAS rounded the first turn about the four path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole then faded into the far turn. KLIMT O'MATIC saved ground close to the early pace, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but faded approaching the far turn. AGAIN WE MEET was not a factor. MIMS SECOND CHANCE stalked three wide on the first turn, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Wave Action
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out,bumped break,4p 1st turn,bid 3/8,5p far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Divinas Connection
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in,bumped break,off rail,up near 1/4,widen,hand ride lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 16600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,25 0 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIAL HER stalked from the three path on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead three wide toward the five sixteenths, drew clear at the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, was steadily handled through the upper stretch then taken in land later yards. LADRO DI FICHI rounded the first turn in the three path, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, improved off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. ARROWWOOD rounded the first turn about the four path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, came through the far turn in the three path, drifted a bit into the lane and came along for third inside the sixteenth pole. JUBA'S HOUSE stalked off the rail the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little more. VILLAREGGIA rounded the first turn about the four path, gave chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and could only improve her position. BONNIE BLUETOOTH rounded the first turn in the two and three paths then left the turn outside, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. A LITTLE BIT CRAZY stumbled at the break then saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. SKYFLY saved ground, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. CHURCH KEY took the lead nearing the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was met approaching the five sixteenths and faded into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Juba's House
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,rail far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Ladro Di Fichi
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p 1st turn,bid past 7/16,off rail far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Church Key
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,met near 5/16,faded into far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 19 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 19 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Whe re Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA BABY rounded the first turn about the five path, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, took the lead in the three path midway on the far turn and was steadily handled to widen. MARINA GRANDE took over past the three quarter pole and tapered to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, was met at the rail midway on the far turn and relented in the run through the stretch. SLEWING raced well off the pace in the three path the first turn, gave chase past the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the six path and came along for third toward mid-stretch. NO DENYING DENIS rounded the opening turn in the four path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and flattened in the lane. LONG LEGS LOUISE raced well back saving ground, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and passed some rivals. LOVE OF GRACE saved early ground, gave chase toward the three eighths pole and entered the far turn near the rail, angled to the five path approaching the head of the lane but showed little further. TRUE FLIRT stalked inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but flattened at the rail on the far turn. HERETODAYGONMANANA raced in the six path the first turn, left the turn outside, showed little response through the backstretch and rounded the far turn in the seven path. KEEP ON SPURRIN raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole then weakened off the rail on the far turn. TIZ A COUNTRY GIRL rounded the first turn off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the six path on the far turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Long Legs Louise
ENTRY.OWNER: Rogers Louie and Lewis Jr William R
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back inside,chased 3/8,3p far turn,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Juba Baby
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Marina Grande
ENTRY.OWNER: Jay A Reese LLC and Hatter Edgar
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured near 3/8,met rail mid turn,relented

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 19, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Ra ces Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AT THE HALF gave chase inside, rounded the turn at the rail and dueled through the stretch to take over the final yards. MAKE IT A DOUBLE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. SUPER WILDCAT set a pressured pace inside and raced at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn but was caught in the final yards. SCARLET TANAGER came away awkwardly then gave chase, rounded the turn about the six path and raced evenly in the lane. LOST ANCHOR pressured the pace through the backstretch and raced close off the rail on the turn, then flattened inside the eighth pole. WOODSONG'S CASTLE raced well back inside, rounded the turn at the rail and ran evenly in the lane. MISS BETTE LUTE became anxious in the gate, gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little in the lane. ONEPRETTYTHING broke awkwardly then gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three and four paths on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Super Wildcat
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,caught final yards

ENTRY.NAME: At the Half
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,dueled stretch,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Bette Lute
ENTRY.COMMENT: anxious gate,chased outside,5p turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Lost Anchor
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,close off rail turn,flattened lane
